intro: Comanthera aurifibrata, commonly known as the golden-fiber comanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, orange to yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Comanthera aurifibrata is typically found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
